summary: The Farmer First Fuel Incentives Act amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to promote the use of domestically sourced feedstocks for clean fuel production. Key provisions include prohibiting the use of foreign feedstocks, adjusting lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions calculations to exclude indirect land use changes, extending the clean fuel production credit, and refining the emissions factor rounding. The bill aims to support U.S. farmers and adjust incentives related to clean fuel production.
